meanings.definition: A person who gathers leftover crops after the main harvest.
meanings.sent1: The gleaner walked through the fields, picking up the remaining corn.
meanings.sent2: The village gleaner collected the last few vegetables to share with others.
meanings.sent3: The gleaner found a giant carrot hidden among the plants, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: She was a gleaner of stories, always seeking out the untold tales of the town.
meanings.sent5: The image of the diligent gleaner under the golden sun stayed with him for years.

meanings.definition: A machine or device used to collect small amounts of grain or other crops left in the field after harvesting.
meanings.sent1: The farmer used a modern gleaner to gather the remaining wheat efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The old gleaner rattled as it moved through the field, picking up the fallen grains.
meanings.sent3: The gleaner machine seemed to have a mind of its own, zipping around the field unpredictably.
meanings.sent4: The gleaner hummed softly as it worked, like a contented bee in a flower field.
meanings.sent5: The gleaming gleaner stood out against the backdrop of the empty field, a lone helper in the vastness.
